properties.NAME: Anderson Hill
properties.DESCRIPTION: Anderson Hill has panoramic views of the Trial Islands, Juan de Fuca Strait and the Olympic Mountains to the south. The park features rock outcrops, Garry Oak ecosystems, native flora and fauna and non-native shrubs and plants.
properties.BLURB: Panoramic Views of the Trial Islands, Juan de Fuca Strait and the Olympic Mountains.

properties.NAME: Beacon Hill Park / míqәn
properties.DESCRIPTION: Beacon Hill Park / miqәn is a crowning jewel in Victoria’s park system. There are natural areas, manicured flower beds, footpaths and many sports and play features for the whole family to enjoy.
properties.BLURB: Natural areas, manicured flower beds, footpaths and many sports and play features.

properties.NAME: Bowker Creek estuary and "Bowker Reef"
properties.DESCRIPTION: Bowker Creek estuary and “Bowker Reef” are located at the south end of Willows Beach. Bowker Creek is the region’s most urban creek, traveling from its headwaters through underground pipes, and emerging in parks and greenspaces in both Saanich and Oak Bay. At its river mouth, the availability of freshwater for drinking and bathing regularly attracts several common and rare birds, making this a favourite regional birdwatching site.
properties.BLURB: A favourite regional birdwatching site.

properties.NAME: Cattle Point
properties.DESCRIPTION: Cattle Point is renowned for its starry skies and several rare plants that flourish in the plants Park. Located in Oak Bay and running along the coastline, this beautiful natural area is an excellent location for birdwatching. It also offers a beautiful viewpoint where you might see Orcas, Grey Whales, and California Sea Lions.
properties.BLURB: Excellent spot for bird watching and sky gazing.

properties.NAME: Coles Bay Regional Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Coles Bay Regional Park offers a gentle swimming beach and forest trails suitable for the whole family. This park is the perfect place for a short stroll, or family picnic, and attracts bird enthusiasts and beach explorers.
properties.BLURB: Perfect spot for short strolls, picnics, bird watching and beach exploring.

properties.NAME: Colquitz River Trail
properties.DESCRIPTION: Colquitz River Trail runs along the Colquitz River, through Cuthbert Holmes Park and Panama Flats. The river is an urban fish habitat with Coho and Chum Salmon commonly seen during their spawning season in the fall. Take a walk and see all the stream restoration work that has occurred.
properties.BLURB: An urban fish habitat.

properties.NAME: Cuthbert Holmes Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Cuthbert Holmes Park is a large urban natural area. It is known to have the largest urban salmon run in the Victoria area. Wetland restoration has occurred, resulting in returning wildlife not seen in the park for decades. Come and enjoy a relatively flat 2 km loop trail.
properties.BLURB: A large urban natural area.

properties.NAME: Elk/Beaver Lake Regional Park / X̱EOL,XELE₭
properties.DESCRIPTION: Elk/Beaver Lake Regional Park / XEOL,XELEK often has a variety of waterfowl that visit these calm waters. Some of the waterfowl you may find are Mergansers, Buffleheads or Canada Geese. The Cottonwood, Pacific Crabapple and Red Alders provide habitat for cavity nesting birds. The park has a variety of recreational opportunities available for all levels, from amateurs to Olympians.
properties.BLURB: A variety of recreational opportunities available for all levels.

properties.NAME: Esquimalt Gorge Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Esquimalt Gorge Park offers many significant trees throughout the rolling landscape including some Umbrella Pines that are over 100 years old. Visit the Japanese garden, nature house, or the children’s playground. There is even a sandy beach that provides access for swimmers and a launch site for paddlers. The fresh water of Gorge Creek that meanders through the park enters the salty waters of the Gorge, creating a nutrient-rich habitat for birds and fish in the estuary.
properties.BLURB: Visit the Japanese garden, nature house or the children's playground.

properties.NAME: Gonzales Hill
properties.DESCRIPTION: Gonzales Hill has ocean views from the highest point of land on the south coast of Vancouver Island. It features a dry, coastal forest of Douglasfir, Garry Oak and Arbutus, and a magnificent view over Gonzales Bay and the City of Victoria to the west. A perfect place to watch the sunset over the Juan de Fuca Strait. It is located next to the historic Gonzales Observatory, a landmark in Greater Victoria now used as an automated weather station.
properties.BLURB: A perfect place to watch the sunset over the Juan de Fuca Strait.

properties.NAME: Harling Point
properties.DESCRIPTION: Harling Point is a small site of natural and cultural significance in Oak Bay, composed of an urban park and private property. Harling Point is located next to a national historic site, a Chinese Cemetery established in 1903. On a clear day, enjoy great views of the Juan de Fuca Strait and the Olympic Mountains across the strait from a  viewpoint near beautiful Gonzales Bay
properties.BLURB: Small site of natural and cultural significance in Oak Bay.

properties.NAME: Island View Beach Regional Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Island View Beach Regional Park offers an expansive sandy beach and panoramic seascape views of Haro Strait, James Island and Mount Baker. Rare dunes, shrubs and wetland ecosystems of this seashore park are home to many resident and migratory bird species, making it a premier birdwatching area. Watch for Marbled Murrelets and Surf Scoters riding the waves and Northern Harriers or Short-eared Owls to be cruising the fields.
properties.BLURB: Expansive sandy beach and panoramic view of Haro Strait, James Island and Mt. Baker.

properties.NAME: Kitty Islet
properties.DESCRIPTION: Kitty Islet is where you can enjoy the peaceful views of Trial Islands, McNeill Bay and the Olympic Mountains from the permanent wooden Adirondack chairs perched on the rocky bluffs. It is an ideal location for fishing and watching the birds and Sea Lions.
properties.BLURB: Ideal location for fishing and watching wildlife.

properties.NAME: The Matson Lands Conservation Area
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Matson Lands Conservation Area contains more than one hundred Garry Oaks, the only native oak tree in western Canada. This gnarly-shaped tree has unique adaptations allowing it to live in the rainshadow of the Vancouver Island, Coastal, and Olympic mountains.
properties.BLURB: Contains more than 100 Garry Oaks.

properties.NAME: Mill Hill Regional Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Mill Hill Regional Park is a little-known oasis, exemplifying the exquisite beauty and ecological wealth of our region. The slopes of Mill Hill protect important remnants of Garry Oak ecosystems, a Douglas-fir forest and a cedar wetland bordering Millstream Creek. In the spring, wildflowers such as camas and White Fawn Lily blanket the hillside.
properties.BLURB: In the spring, wildflowers such as Camas and White Fawn Lily cover the hillside.

properties.NAME: Mount Douglas Park / P'kols
properties.DESCRIPTION: Mount Douglas Park / P’kols offers a spectactular 360-degree view of the area around Victoria. This marine shore to hilltop park is popular, hosting a network of trails along its forested slopes and down to the beach. At the beach it is common to see a wide range of waterfowl, Harbour Seals and sometimes even Orca.
properties.BLURB: Spectacular 360 degree view of Greater Victoria.

properties.NAME: Mount Work Regional Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Mount Work Regional Park is the dominant hill on the horizon from many vantage points in Saanich, Victoria and the Saanich Peninsula. This popular recreation spot features three freshwater lakes and a variety of easy and challenging trails where visitors can hike through forest to the summit. Durrance Lake, on the park’s north side, is wheelchair-accessible and features a public swimming beach, boat launch and a hiking loop.
properties.BLURB: This popular spot offers three freshwater lakes and a variety of easy to challenging trails.

properties.NAME: Rithet's Bog
properties.DESCRIPTION: Rithet’s Bog conservation area is home to several rare plant species. Its wetland provides habitat to a wide variety of birds. During the summer months you will see Cedar Waxwings, Violet-green Swallows and Tree Swallows and during the winter, Mallards, American Coots, and Great Blue Herons. The 2.8 km trail is fairly flat and can be walked in about 1 hour.
properties.BLURB: Home to several rare plant species.

properties.NAME: Saxe Point Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Saxe Point Park is a popular destination for SCUBA diving, dog walking, and weddings. Forested trails and beach accesses are set among mature Douglas-fir and Grand-fir with many trails leading to beach coves, gardens, and a picnic area. The open grassy area boasts amazing views of the majestic Olympic Mountains and the Strait of Juan de Fuca.
properties.BLURB: Popular destination for diving, dog walking and weddings.

properties.NAME: Swan Lake Chrismas Hill Nature Sanctuary
properties.DESCRIPTION: Swan Lake Christmas Hill Nature Sanctuary is an accessible urban green space with two distinct ecosystems: a rare Garry Oak meadow atop Christmas Hill and a low wetland around Swan Lake. The sanctuary is vital for protecting threatened species and the Colquitz River watershed. Visitors can enjoy a floating boardwalk where ducks and River Otters swim among yellow pond lilies. Keen observers might spot endangered Western Painted Turtles basking in the sun!
properties.BLURB: The sanctuary is vital for protecting threatened species.

properties.NAME: Walbran Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Walbran Park provides viewpoints from which to enjoy magnificent views of ocean, mountain, and the surrounding urban and waterfront landscape, as well as opportunity to learn about the historical and conservation significance of the area. A short trail is just steps to a historical monument. Some minor trails are not accessible by wheeled apparatuses.
properties.BLURB: Enjoy magnificient views of ocean, mountains, and urban and waterfront landscapes.

properties.NAME: Government House
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located on the traditional territory of the Songhees and Esquimalt First Nations, Government House is the office and official residence of the Lieutenant Governor and the ceremonial home of all British Columbians. The Government House gardens are open to the public and are lovingly maintained by hundreds of volunteers who raise funds and ensure the future of this remnant Garry Oak landscape. In 2017, the Lieutenant Governor at the time, the Honourable Judith Guichon, designated the grounds of Government House as an official NatureHood site within Greater Victoria, with the goal to inspire Victoria residents to enjoy the outdoors and connect with the natural environment that is around them every day.
